Dear Sir, Re ferric to your I emoranduni Ho; 112-28/5 enclosing a copy of Memorandim No; 1673/3 of 16th January 1938 xrom the .^iviser to the Bahrein Govermaent will you please inform us whether it will be in order for the Captains of the tankers to disembark a^ bitrsih for the purpose of carrying out necessary business with regard to their cargoes and whether it will be in order for ships at the Sitrah anchorage to land members of their crew for medical attention if required. Yours very truly, G.l'.H. Memorandum . A \ Reference your memoranduni No» 1673 /3 dated the 16th January 1938, 2. I enclose herewith copies of letters which I have received from Messrs. Gray, Mackenzie and Company and from the Bahrain Petroleum Company Limited. If you see no ob- jectlon T suggest that the reply might be that the Bahrain Government do not object to the Captains of ships anchored at Sitrah landing at Sltrah purely on ship 's^ business, or to members of crews being landed if they should be in need of medical assistance which can be given at the Bahrain Petroleum Company's hospital. It might be added that these privileges ore liable to be withdrawn at any time if, in the opinion of the Bahrain Government, circumstances so require. Memorandum: - ■ V /T 4 In fiirther reference to my memorandum No. 1673/3 dated 16th J^iiuary 1938 and your memorandum No. 253-28/5 dated 13th February 1938 on the subject of persons from ships anchored at Sitra: the Bahrain Government do not object to the Captains of ships an chored at Sitra landing at Sitrah purely on ship's business or to members of crews being landed if they should be in need of medical assistance which can be given at the Bahrain Petroleum Company^ hospital. But these pri vileges are liable to be withdrawn at any time, if, in the opinion of the Bahrain Government, circumstances so require. Adviser to the Government. titleInfo.title: 'File 28/5 III Visits of tankers and steamers etc. to Sitrah Terminus.'

physicalDescription.extent: The documents in the file are arranged in chronological order. There are notes at the end of the file, (folios 275-284). The file notes are arranged chronologically and refer to documents within the file; they give a brief description of the correspondence with a reference number, which refers back to that correspondence in the file.

The foliation is written in pencil and can be found in the top right corner. The numbering starts at the front cover with 1A; then 1B and 1C; 2-102; 103A, 103B, 103C, 103D and 103E; 104-132; 133 and 133A; and then continues through to 285, which is the last number given to the back cover of the file. The numbering is repeating from 124 to 133.

mods.abstract: The file contains correspondence between the Political Agent in Bahrain, the Financial Adviser to the Government at Bahrain, Charles Dalrymple Belgrave, and representatives of the Bahrain Petroleum Company Limited (BAPCO) and Gray, Mackenzie & Co. on shipments from Sitra terminus.The file mainly contains copies of Royalty Delivery Tickets showing the amount of oil shipped during 1938, transmitted by the Political Agent in Bahrain to the Secretary of State for India and the Political Resident in the Gulf.

name.namePart: Gray, Mackenzie and Company Limited, shipping agents
